title: Human Body Systems and Interactions

vocab.definition: A group of organs that work together to perform a specific function
The system that moves blood throughout the body
The system that helps you breathe and exchange gases
The system that breaks down food to provide nutrients
The system that controls and coordinates body activities
The body system of bones that supports and protects
The body system of muscles that helps you move
The system that removes liquid wastes from the body
The system that helps protect the body from disease
The body's way of keeping internal conditions stable

teachingNotes: Focus on how different body systems work together. Use diagrams to show connections between systems. Discuss how the body maintains itself through system interactions.

sample.question: How do the circulatory and respiratory systems work together?
What is the job of the digestive system?
How do the muscular and skeletal systems work together?
What does the excretory system remove?
How does the circulatory system move materials?

truefalse.question: The nervous system controls many body activities.
The digestive system adds oxygen to blood.
The respiratory system brings oxygen into the body.
The circulatory system moves blood around the body.
Muscles attach to bones to help you move.
The immune system helps fight disease.
Systems often work together to do a job.
The heart is part of the respiratory system.

multiplechoice.question: Which system breaks down food into nutrients?
Which system brings oxygen into the body?
Which two systems help you move?
Which part adds oxygen to blood?
Which organ is part of the digestive system?

fillintheblank.question: The ________ system pumps blood throughout your body.
The ________ system brings oxygen into the body.
The ________ take in oxygen and release carbon dioxide.
The body uses ________ to carry materials around.

shortanswer.question: What happens when you exercise that shows systems working together?
Explain how the respiratory and circulatory systems work together.
expectedAny: oxygen from lungs carried by blood
lungs add oxygen and blood delivers it

shortanswer.question: Give one example of the digestive system helping another system.
How does the nervous system help you move?
expectedAny: brain and nerves tell muscles to move

shortanswer.question: What systems help remove waste from the body?
How does the immune system protect you?
Which systems help deliver oxygen to cells?
Why do athletes need the digestive system?
How do bones and muscles work together?
expectedAny: bones provide support, muscles pull to move
skeleton gives shape and muscles move it

shortanswer.question: What system helps you think and react quickly?
